explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not ignite spontaneously on coming into contact with air at normal temperatures

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 3 based on SPECIES: Rat; VALUE: 248mg/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: ACGIH (2001), IUCLID (2000)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since the calculation value using two or more data of the rabbit dermal acute toxicity values (IUCLID (2000)) is 582mg/kg, it is in Category 3.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Since the rat 4-hour inhalation acute toxicity value was 4040ppm (PATTY (2001)) and 5780ppm (IUCLID (2000)), adopting the lower data and classified it as Category 4.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There are reports of corrosivity for many studies on rabbits. (IUCLID(2000))

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In many animals studies report with irritant (IUCLID (2000)), but there is also a description with damage to a serious eye (ACGIH (2001)). Moreover, since corrosion of the skin / irritation is categoried into Category 1, critical damage / irritation over an eye are set as category 1.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: About respiratory sensitization, there is no data and it cannot be classified. Although there is a datum about skin sensitization describing that a Mouse ear swelling test did not identify it(IUCLID (2000)), this is not enough to put it outside of Category.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: In the in vivo examinations, such as the dominant lethality examination using the rat, the micronucleus assay, and the sex-linked recessive lethals examination using the drosophilas, the positive result was not obtained for diethylamine itself (ACGIH (2001)). Moreover, many negative results for in vitro examination (Ames test) were obtained (ACGIH (2001), IUCLID (2000)). Therefore we judged it as Out Of Category. However, diethylamine showed mutagenicity when administered simultaneously with nitrous acid (DFGOT vol.1 (1991)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: In the test using a guinea pigs, carcinogenic was not acknowledged, and it has been classified into A4 (ACGIH (2001)). So it carried out the outside of category. However, it is reported that diethylamine changes to nitrosamine in the internal (ACGIH (2001)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (liver, respiratory)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Starting corrosive to respiratory tract and pulmonary edemas in human is pointed out (ICSC (J) (1997)). Moreover, in short-term exposure in a rabbit, the influence of fatty liver degeneration, pulmonary edemas, emphysema, etc. is regarded (RTECS (2005)). So it is classified into Category 2 (target organ: liver, respiratory-organs system).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (kidneys, respiratory organs) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Effect was observed in lungs and the kidney in the inhalation study of 100 ppm for six weeks to a rabbit (ACGIH (2001)). This concentration is within the limits of the guidance value of Category 1 in 90-day conversion. Effect was observed at lesion of the respiratory system epithelium etc. in the inhalation study of 250 ppm for 24 weeks to the rat (ACGIH (2001)). This density is within the limits of the guidance value of Category 2. According to this point, Category 1, and target organ are the kidney and the respiratory systems.

aspiration_hazard.rationale: We have a report of the case of pneumonia by the exposure in the accident (ACGIH (2001)), however, we could not classify it because not obvious of occuring by aspiration.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96-hour LC50=27mg/L of fishes (Oryzias latipes) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 1999).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 89% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=0.58 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
